page.title: 10Transport (part 1)
page.content: In this survey we surveyed buses and we found that the buses only came one every hour, and that sometimes they never came at all. The service is very unreliable, and for the three hours we were there, only two buses came. The buses that run through the village are the C30 to Chester or Warrington. The bus stops are both situated by the "Ring O'Bells" public house in the centre of Daresbury, by the church. The nearest railway station is at Runcorn East, which is two miles away. Transport to the nearby towns of Warrington,Runcorn and Chester is therefore difficult unless people have their own cars.
